page.title: 20History of Acklington (3)
page.content: {1974}Acklington Open-cast mine begins. {1977}Village school reorganised along "comprehensive" lines and became a First School (pupils aged 4-9). {1979}Shop and new Post Office opens in village. {1985}The Domesday Survey is carried out thanks to the help of the following children from the local school, and their teachers Mr J. Davison and Mr J. Nelson. { Heidi Cheyne, James Champion, { Nina Henderson, Louise Hopwood, { Jodie Smith and Philip Belcher { }(all aged 9). { Richard Hall, Verity Currie, { Heather Shanks, Alan Hobson, Dawn { Mitchell}(all aged 8). { Keith Henderson, Amanda Ness, { Christopher Slater, Caroline { Wilburn, Simon Wright and Kiri {Henderson}(all aged 7).
